page.title: 05ROYAL VICTORIA PIER,VENTNOR.
page.content: The first pier, built in 1860, was washed away. A second pier was built in 1870. The Council bought it for Â£2,600 in 1880 and it is now controlled by the Ventnor Local Board Act 1884. A hole was made in it during the War and was eventually rebuilt and re-opened in 1955. It is 683 feet long and built on cast iron piles. The main deck is wooden and the pier-head is made of concrete. Nowadays the main attraction on the pier is an Amusement Arcade, with fruit machines, computer games and Bingo. People fish from the pier-head where large conger eels can be caught. There are plans to rebuild the pier and restore it to its original form with a landing stage for boats, better fishing facilities and a tea room.
